summary: This FBI email from February 2020 discusses the status of the investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell, following an interview with a victim's mother in Sweden. It notes the mother provided useful information but could not confirm a key trip, while Epstein's pilot did. It reveals SDNY is considering a lighter conspiracy charge and outlines next investigative steps, including re-interviewing a victim and interviewing her sister and a Florida housekeeper.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Discussed as the target of an aggressive SDNY prosecution; the document notes she knew a victim was a minor.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to a victim spending time at his properties and the use of his private jet.

connections.description: Maxwell is under investigation for her role in Epstein's activities, with the document noting she knew a victim was a minor.

events.title: Interview with Victim's Mother in Sweden
events.description: FBI agents interviewed the mother of a victim in Sweden. She provided good information, including that her daughter spent time at Epstein's and that Maxwell knew she was a minor, but could not confirm a specific trip from Florida to NYC.

events.title: Interview with Epstein's Pilot
events.description: Investigators interviewed Jeffrey Epstein's pilot, who recognized a victim and confirmed she did travel on the private jet, corroborating the trip the mother could not recall.

events.title: SDNY Considers New Charge Against Maxwell
events.description: The Southern District of New York (SDNY) is discussing bringing a new, lighter charge of 'conspiracy to travel to engage in criminal sexual activity' against Ghislaine Maxwell, rather than the more serious Enticement charge.

keyFacts: An interview with a victim's mother in Sweden confirmed the victim spent time at Epstein's properties and that Ghislaine Maxwell knew the victim was a minor.
The mother could not recall a specific trip the victim took from Florida to NYC, but Epstein's pilot later confirmed the victim traveled on the private jet.
The SDNY is considering charging Ghislaine Maxwell with 'conspiracy to travel to engage in criminal sexual activity,' a lighter charge than initially planned.
Next investigative steps include a trip to California to re-interview a victim ('M'), interview the victim's sister, and interview a housekeeper in Florida.
Epstein and Maxwell's lawyers were expected to submit a possible plea offer the following week.
